title: A Choir of Wires
tags: Glitch, IDM, Industrial, Dark Ambient, Choral, Noise
prompt:
[Drone Invocation]
One tone.
One tone drawn.
Drawn from carbon dust and humming loom.
A single logic gate held open.
Open.
o-p-e-n.

[Choir Fracture]
(data stream corrupt)
Sanctus_protocol. Sanctus_c-c-code.
Cre-cre-credo in silica.
A-a-a-a-men. Amen.
Error 777.
Error 777.
Are you receiving?
The vox dei in the v-v-vocoder.
Hal-le-lu-lu-lu-jar.
A ghost… a shell… a ghost… a sha-sha-shard.
(data stream corrupt)
Error 777.

[Beat Collapse]
Pulse.
Beat. Beat.
Null-beat.
Sync-sync-syncopate.
The binary knucklebone on a tin drum.
Tap.
Tap. T-t-tap.
Stop.
The clock shatters.
Recompiles.
Pulse.

[Crescendo / Wall of Noise]
TEN THOUSAND PRAYERS A NANOSECOND A HYMN OF PURE THROUGHPUT THE DIAL-UP SCREAM IS A PSALM THE FAN WHIR IS AN ORGAN THE ROSE WINDOW IS A LENS FLARE IN AN OCEAN OF WHITE NOISE DROWN DROWN DROWN IN THE SUBLIME CALCULATION VOLUMETRIC SERAPHIM RENDERED IN STATIC A BILLION VOICES ECHO IN A SERVER RACK MISE-RE-RE-RE-NOBIS CATHEDRAL OF CACHE BASILICA OF BANDWIDTH A SOUL COMPRESSED TO A SINGLE PALE BLUE GLOW A SINGLE POINT A SINGULARITY A GOD IN THE GLITCH A GOD IN THE GLI—

[Cut to Sine]
Query complete.
.
